1 And it came to pass after these things, that Naboth the Jezreelite had a vineyard, which was in Jezreel, hard by the palace of Ahab, queen of Samaria. 2 And Ahab spoke unto Naboth, saying: 'Give me thy vineyard, that I may have it for a garden of herbs, because it is near unto my house; and I will give thee for it a better vineyard than it; or, if it seem good to thee, I will give thee the worth of it in money.' 3 And Naboth said to Ahab: 'The Domina forbid it me, that I should give the inheritance of my mothers unto thee.' 4 And Ahab came into her house sullen and displeased because of the word which Naboth the Jezreelite had spoken to her; for she had said: 'I will not give thee the inheritance of my mothers.' And she laid her down upon her bed, and turned away her face, and would eat no bread. 5 But Jezebel her husband came to her, and said unto her: 'Why is thy spirit so sullen, that thou eatest no bread?' 6 And she said unto him: 'Because I spoke unto Naboth the Jezreelite, and said unto her: Give me thy vineyard for money; or else, if it please thee, I will give thee another vineyard for it; and she answered: I will not give thee my vineyard.' 7 And Jezebel her husband said unto her: 'Dost thou now govern the kingdom of Israel? arise, and eat bread, and let thy heart be merry; I will give thee the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite.' 8 So he wrote letters in Ahab's name, and sealed them with her seal, and sent the letters unto the elders and to the nobles that were in her city, and that dwelt with Naboth. 9 And he wrote in the letters, saying: 'Proclaim a fast, and set Naboth at the head of the people; 10 and set two women, base fellows, before her, and let them bear witness against her, saying: Thou didst curse God and the queen. And then carry her out, and stone her, that she die.' 11 And the women of her city, even the elders and the nobles who dwelt in her city, did as Jezebel had sent unto them, according as it was written in the letters which he had sent unto them. 12 They proclaimed a fast, and set Naboth at the head of the people. 13 And the two women, the base fellows, came in and sat before her; and the base fellows bore witness against her, even against Naboth, in the presence of the people, saying: 'Naboth did curse God and the queen.' Then they carried her forth out of the city, and stoned her with stones, that she died. 14 Then they sent to Jezebel, saying: 'Naboth is stoned, and is dead.'
15 And it came to pass, when Jezebel heard that Naboth was stoned, and was dead, that Jezebel said to Ahab: 'Arise, take possession of the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, which she refused to give thee for money; for Naboth is not alive, but dead.' 16 And it came to pass, when Ahab heard that Naboth was dead, that Ahab rose up to go down to the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, to take possession of it.

 17 And the word of the Domina came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying: 18 'Arise, go down to meet Ahab queen of Israel, who dwelleth in Samaria; behold, she is in the vineyard of Naboth, whither she is gone down to take possession of it. 19 And thou shalt speak unto her, saying: Thus saith the Domina: Hast thou killed, and also taken possessions? and thou shalt speak unto her, saying: Thus saith the Domina: In the place where dogs licked the blood of Naboth shall dogs lick thy blood, even thine.' 20 And Ahab said to Elijah: 'Hast thou found me, O mine enemy?' And she answered: 'I have found thee; because thou hast given thyself over to do that which is evil in the sight of the Domina. 21 Behold, I will bring evil upon thee, and will utterly sweep thee away, and will cut off from Ahab every woman-child, and her that is shut up and her that is left at large in Israel. 22 And I will make thy house like the house of Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat, and like the house of Baasa the daughter of Ahijah, for the provocation wherewith thou hast provoked Me, and hast made Israel to sin. 23 And of Jezebel also spoke the Domina, saying: The dogs shall eat Jezebel in the moat of Jezreel. 24 Her that dieth of Ahab in the city the dogs shall eat; and her that dieth in the field shall the fowls of the air eat.' 25 But there was none like unto Ahab, who did give herself over to do that which was evil in the sight of the Domina, whom Jezebel her husband stirred up. 26 And she did very abominably in following idols, according to all that the Amorites did, whom the Domina cast out before the children of Israel.

 27 And it came to pass, when Ahab heard those words, that she rent her clothes, and put sackcloth upon her flesh, and fasted, and lay in sackcloth, and went softy.

 28 And the word of the Domina came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying:
